cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northeast toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep across the southeastern United States and move offshore of the mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Grand Isle LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River and from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to Yankeetown FL; storm-surge warning Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast, Florida Panhandle, then the Atlantic coasts of GA, SC, NC, and the mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to 25–35 mph possible late Sunday into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected in the Delaware River; tidal anomalies less than 1 ft
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible as the remnant low passes offshore, causing brief reductions in visibility and slick terminal surfaces
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief river current increases and rough seas on approach channels may prompt temporary pilotage or vessel-speed restrictions
